subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|彑|米|糸|廾|t1=head|t2=rice|t3=silk|t4=two hands|ls=ic|ls2=psc|c1=p|c2=s|c3=s|c4=s}}- a sacrificial bird with its wings tied is held with two hands, the head of which is represented by '[[彑]]', the body of which is now represented by '[[米]]' (no connection to the meaning of '[[米]]'), the string which ties the wing represented by '[[糸]]' and the hands represented by '[[廾]]'. Or instead of a bird, a slave. The '[[彑]]' component was mentioned as a phonetic in Shuowen.

subSections.title: Compounds
subSections.text: {{zh-der|伯彝|功銘鼎彝|匪彝|宗彝|彝倫|彝倫攸斁|彝劇|彝器|彝憲|彝文|彝族|彝訓|彝語|斝彝|方彝|朱彝尊|民彝|秉彝|蜼彝|鼎彝}}
